content:
It sounds like the sales associate was knowledgeable and helpful, and they confirmed that you made a great purchase.

It's excellent to hear that you've already put your new shoes to the test and they've been performing well. 10 runs is a good amount of mileage to get a feel for how they'll hold up, and it's great that you've found them to be comfortable.

Comfort is crucial when it comes to running shoes, as it can make a big difference in your overall running experience. If your shoes are comfortable, you'll be more likely to enjoy your runs and want to keep going.

Now that you've got a good pair of shoes, you might want to consider other aspects of your running routine, such as your form, pace, and nutrition. Have you thought about tracking your runs or setting any goals for yourself?

Remember, it's always important to listen to your body and take rest days as needed. But with your new shoes and a comfortable fit, you're off to a great start!
